data.Title: Google Search Updates
data.Description: Google has been busy with several search updates including algorithm volatility, an indexing bug, testing auto-playing video thumbnails in search results, and confirming that ads can now appear below organic featured snippets. Google has also simplified the process for online stores to add shipping and return policies in Search Console.

data.Title: Google Ads Updates
data.Description: Google Ads has undergone some changes, including a potential default to broad match for search campaigns, testing a "people also browsed" feature, and displaying shopping ads in a double-row carousel. There are also reports of uncertainty regarding whether broad match is now the default setting for all search campaigns.

data.Title: Bing Search Engine Updates
data.Description: Bing is testing out a new feature that allows users to vote on the relevance of search results. The search engine is also discontinuing its cashback feature, which allowed users to earn rewards by scanning receipts.

data.Title: AI in Search & Content
data.Description: OpenAI is reportedly working on its own search product and has defined a five-level system to track its progress toward Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).  There is discussion about the prevalence of AI-generated content in Google's search results, with some analysis contradicting reports of a decline in AI overviews.  Additionally, Amazon has launched its AI shopping assistant, Rufus, for all US customers.

data.Title: JavaScript Rendering and SEO
data.Description: A recent Search Off the Record podcast episode featuring Google's Martin Splitt discussed the impact of JavaScript rendering on SEO. The episode covered the cost of rendering, Google's ability to handle JavaScript, and the importance of structured data.

data.Title: COPIED Act Seeks to Protect Content Creators from AI
data.Description: The US Senate is considering a new bill, the COPIED Act, designed to protect the content of artists and journalists from unauthorized use by AI. The bill aims to give content owners more control over their work and prevent the creation of deepfakes.

data.Title: Google My Business Updates
data.Description: Google My Business (now Google Business Profile) has new consumer alerts and businesses are advised to remove Thumbtack booking links from their profiles if they were added without consent.

data.Title: Majestic Discontinues Disavow Links Feature
data.Description: Majestic has decided to discontinue its disavow links feature, stating that they do not identify or report on toxic links and encourage a focus on positive SEO practices.

data.Title: Google's March 2024 Core Update Feedback
data.Description: Google's John Mueller has stated that the feedback received on the March 2024 core update has been valuable for their evaluations and discussions, suggesting that it has been shared with the search quality and ranking teams.

data.Title: 3D/AR Objects in Google Search Results
data.Description: Google is expanding the availability of 3D/AR objects in search results to more retailers beyond those who participated in the initial beta test.

data.Title: Ugly Ads Can Be Effective
data.Description: Marketer Barry Hott argues that unconventional and attention-grabbing ads, often perceived as "ugly," can outperform more polished designs by avoiding ad skipping and making a strong first impression.
